page.title: 05The Builders Merchants
page.content: The building is very smart. We expect- ed bricks and cement scattered about. It was the complete opposite. The garden was well-kept and tidy with a neat lawn and shrubs. The owner said the{Council}had ordered that the site should look well cared-for. Tiles are on the roof where it faces the road. The company owns an apple orchard at the back. The man gives his employees free apples in autumn. Outside the building is an old petrol and diesel pump. These pumps are still in use. There is an old office, but it is not in use. The site used to be a saw mill. Every day a lorry comes to collect{plumbing and bathroom equip- {ment}because the Lewisham showrooms are not big enough to hold it all. People come here from around Kent and Sussex to buy their goods.
